ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about a wide variety of crucial themes and arguments in athletic history and present day events. I was also able to familiarize myself with many patterns that highlight the intersection between sports and politics. This course improved my analytical writing skills.
I learned a different type of writing style, facts about athletes and how politics and sports are co-interdependent.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The guest speakers and documentaries screen during class were beneficial because they presented the course material through a different outlet. Some of the readings were monotonous, and we often did not touch on them in great detail during class.

Strengths: Lots of insightful discussions

Weaknesses: Spending too much class-time watching long videos

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, but it helps if you are interested in sports.
Yes! I learned a lot and this course widened my perspective on what it meant to be an athlete. I would highly recommend this course to someone else
